intro: Allantodia dushanensis, commonly known as the Dushan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
